Description: Upper section of a painted limestone shabti of a woman with a black plaited gala-wig, a white diadem of lotus-petals, a carved brown face with the eyes traced in black, a red, yellow and black collar over the breast, the waist is inscribed with the surviving part of a central column of black painted Hieroglyphs flanked by red borders, the legs are missing.
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 1995 Feb-May, Atlanta, Emory University, Reflections of Women in the New Kingdom
